intro: Helixyra sisyrinchium, commonly known as the blue-eyed grass, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its slender, grass-like foliage and small, showy blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as wet meadows and along stream banks. Its flowers bloom in early spring, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. Helixyra sisyrinchium is a perennial plant that spreads through rhizomes, forming dense colonies in suitable environments.
